Well, if it's a regular iso, just use winrar and decompress this ISO and then make an xiso from the files with your favorite program (Qwix..  C-Xbox tool etc..)

Here's a simple fix (Winrar would not decompress the iso, for me) 

1.Daemon Tool will mount the iso
2.Then use Qwix, to make a new xiso from Local Folder(Virtual Drive)
3.Transfer/Burn the new iso
4.Play

Because I had already burnt the original ISO to disc, I then dragged the files from this disc back onto my Hard Drive, then used Qwix to rebuild a new ISO. This new ISO worked fine when burnt to  disc. Got there in the end :-)

I tried everything, still doesn't work. Don't bother with this one.

Works fine once converted to x-iso.
Thanks.

yes!  this works!  make sure you follow the directions.
mount the iso with some virtual drive program
then make the xiso file (which will produce another file with the iso extension)
at this point, you can either burn the xiso file to a real disc or you can extract the xiso file and then ftp the files to the xbox
